page.title: 15Ecology Cricket Bat Willows
page.content: Last Friday we went on our first trip for "The Domesday Project".We had to walk along the roads down into the valley.In the valley there was a stream with trees on either side.The stream was called Cambridge Brook. These trees were cricket bat willows.They are used to make cricket bats because willows grow very fast and so have less grain. The cricket bat is best made from a wood with little grain so that it does not split when it is in contact with a hard ball.Willows take fourteen years to grow to a height of 6_8 metres. Willow wood is also suitable for the making of artificial limbs because it is so light in weight.
